lead_paragraph: A secondary school in northeast France sent a 15-year-old student home for wearing a long skirt that the principal judged was “an ostentatious sign” of the girl’s Muslim faith.

headline.print_headline: French School Deems Long Skirt a Religious Display
headline.main: French School Deems Teenager’s Skirt an Illegal Display of Religion

snippet: A secondary school in northeast France sent a 15-year-old student home for wearing a long skirt that the principal judged was “an ostentatious sign” of the girl’s Muslim faith.
abstract: Leo Lagrange secondary school in Charleville-Mezieres, France, has sent a student home twice within two weeks for wearing long skirt that school officials deem emblematic of Muslim faith; school claims to be acting in accordance with 2004 law forbidding wearing of articles with clear religious affiliation at school, but decision has sparked controversy and accusations of discrimination.
